required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Singapore Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Study of the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System For The Treatment of Patients Requiring Tympanostomy Tube Insertion For Otitis Media

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS) in the placement of tympanostomy tubes (TTs) in patients indicated for such treatment for chronic otitis media with effusion (OME) or recurrent acute otitis media (AOM).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Ears Treated Successfully With the TTDS in the Absence of Acute Intraprocedural Adverse Events.
primary_outcome.description: TTDS success will be confirmed by the successful delivery of a tube to the tympanic membrane.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Tympanostomy Tubes Extruded at 12 Months Post Procedure

secondary_outcome.description: This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Ears With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome measure evaluates occurrence of new adverse events since prior follow-up visit. (non-cumulative)

arm_group.description: Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS) used for placement of tympanostomy tubes in patients indicated for such treatment for chronic Otitis Media with Effusion (OME) or recurrent Acute Otitis Media(AOM).

intervention.description: Placement of the Tympanostomy Tube by the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. >= 1 year of age
2. Diagnosed with either Chronic Otitis Media with Effusion or recurrent Acute Otitis Media and scheduled to undergo bilateral or unilateral tympanostomy tube insertion.
3. Either male or female -
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of sensitivity or reaction to anaesthesia
2. Markedly atrophic, retracted, atelectatic or perforated tympanic membrane.
3. Otitis externa
4. Active acute otitis media
5. Thickened Tympanic Membrane
6. Thick mucoid effusion (also known as "glue ear")
7. Otitis media pathology requiring T-tubes -

overall_official.affiliation: KK Women's and Children's Hospital, Singapore

facility.name: KK Women's and Children's Hospital Singapore

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Consecutive eligible patients presenting to the study site and for whom tube insertion was recommended were offered the opportunity by the investigator to participate in the study.

group.title: Tympanic Tube Placement
group.description: Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS) in the placement of tympanostomy tubes in patients indicated for such treatment for chronic Otitis Media with Effusion (OME) or recurrent Acute Otitis Media(AOM). Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System: Placement of the Tympanostomy Tube by the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS)

participants_list.participants: Final visit = the earlier of 24 months post-procedure or 12 months after extrusion.
One completed (evidencing extrusions) at 23.5 mos. Missed 9 mo visit. Exam not possible at 12 mo.

outcome.description: TTDS success will be confirmed by the successful delivery of a tube to the tympanic membrane.
outcome.population: One subject was missing data on intraprocedural adverse events and is excluded from this analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Tympanostomy Tubes Extruded at 12 Months Post Procedure
outcome.population: Over the course of 12 months, a total of 17 subjects (25 ears) were assessed at varying follow-up time points as having had tubes extruded. Ears analyzed included those for which a tube was observed to extrude at any follow-up visit and ears that completed the 12 month visit.

group.title: Tympanic Tube Placement
group.description: Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS) in the placement of tympanostomy tubes in patients indicated for such treatment for chronic Otitis Media with Effusion (OME) or recurrent Acute Otitis Media(AOM). Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System: Placement of the Tympanostomy Tube by the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS)

measure.title: Percentage of Tympanostomy Tubes Extruded at 12 Months Post Procedure
measure.population: Over the course of 12 months, a total of 17 subjects (25 ears) were assessed at varying follow-up time points as having had tubes extruded. Ears analyzed included those for which a tube was observed to extrude at any follow-up visit and ears that completed the 12 month visit.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patent Tubes
outcome.description: This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
outcome.population: One subject (one ear) was lost to follow-up immediately following the procedure.

group.title: Tympanic Tube Placement

measure.title: Percentage of Patent Tubes
measure.description: This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
measure.population: One subject (one ear) was lost to follow-up immediately following the procedure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patent Tubes
outcome.description: This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
outcome.population: Two subjects were lost to follow-up after the 30 day visit and one subject missed the 3 month visit. One subject was lost to follow-up immediately following the procedure. Thus, only 28 ears of 21 participants had unextruded tubes for assessment of tube patency.

group.title: Tympanic Tube Placement

measure.title: Percentage of Patent Tubes
measure.description: This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
measure.population: Two subjects were lost to follow-up after the 30 day visit and one subject missed the 3 month visit. One subject was lost to follow-up immediately following the procedure. Thus, only 28 ears of 21 participants had unextruded tubes for assessment of tube patency.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patent Tubes
outcome.description: This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
outcome.population: Two subjects lost to follow-up after 3 month visit. Two subjects missed 6 month visit. Two subjects lost to follow-up after 30 day visit. One subject lost to follow-up immediately following procedure. Thus, only 13 ears (= 9 participants) of 18 participants returning at 6 months had unextruded tubes for assessment of patency.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patent Tubes
outcome.description: This measure assesses the patency (openness or lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes.
outcome.population: 3 subjects lost to follow-up after 6 mo visit. 1 subject missed 9 mo visit. 2 subjects lost to follow-up after 3 mo visit. 2 subjects lost to follow-up after 30 day visit. 1 subject lost to follow-up following procedure. Thus, only 3 ears (= 3 participants) of 16 participants returning at 9 mos had unextruded tubes for assessment of patency.

reported_events.time_frame: Final follow-up visit was the earlier of 24 months post-procedure or 12 months after tube extrusion.

group.title: Tympanic Tube Placement
group.description: Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS) in the placement of tympanostomy tubes in patients indicated for such treatment for chronic Otitis Media with Effusion (OME) or recurrent Acute Otitis Media(AOM). Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System: Placement of the Tympanostomy Tube by the Acclarent Tympanostomy Tube Delivery System (TTDS)

event.description: Subject presented with blood in ear and a case of influenza

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The protocol called for outcome measure assessing patency (openness/lack of obstruction) of unextruded tubes at 12 mos post procedure. Since all tubes had already been extruded by 12 mos, no ears with tubes remained for assessment and it was omitted.
